metatab-latest: The Current Population Survey (CPS) is the primary source of labor force
statistics for the population of the United States.

column4: Original text of the data dictionary
All of the variables and their cleaned text descriptions
Text descriptions of the integer values of categorical variables.
Basic Monthly Current Population Survey, January 2023
Final Outcome Code Outcome codes between 001 and 020 are for CATI. All other outcome codes are for CAPI.
Unique person identifier. Valid only within any specific month.
Line Number of the Current Respondent
Number of actual and attempted personal contacts.
Does anyone in this household have a business or a farm?
Unique household identifier. Valid only within any specific month.
Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) State Code.
Is there a telephone elsewhere on which people in this household can be contacted?
Is there a telephone in this house/apartment?
Total number of persons living in the household (household members)

Family income (combined income of all family members during the last 12 months. Includes money from jobs, net income from business, farm or rent, pensions, dividends, interest, social security payments and any other money income received by family members who are 15 years of age or older.) Note: Caution should be used when using this variable since it has an allocation rate of approximately 20 percent.
Household weight (4 implied decimal places) used for tallying household characteristics
Line number (PULINENO) of the person whose PWSSWGT was donated as HWHHWGT for the household.
Last week, did you do any work for (either) pay (or profit)?
Last week, did you do any unpaid work in the family business or farm?
Disability status (last month you were reported to have a disability.) Does your disability continue to prevent you from doing any kind of work for the next 6 months?
Last week, were you on layoff from a job?
Last week, did you lose or take off any hours from your job, for any reason such as illness, slack work, vacation, or holiday?
How many hours did you take off?
Last week, did you work any overtime or extra hours (at your main job) that you do not usually work?
How many additional hours did you work?
Last week did you have a job either full or part-time?
Check Item 1 filter for questions on unpaid work
Check Item 2 skips owners of family businesses who did not work last week
Retirement status (last month you were reported to be retired, are you still retired this month?)
Check Item 2 skips persons responding yes to HRFTPT out of PT series.
Has your employer given you a date to return to work?
Have you been given any indication that you will be recalled to work within the next 6 months?
Have you been doing anything to find work during the last 4 weeks?
Check Item 2 screen for dependent layoff.
Check Item 3 filter for dependent I & O.
Filter for persons going through the I and O series
Did you do any of this work in the last 4 weeks?
You said you have been trying to find work. How did you go about looking? (First Method).
Can you tell me more about what you did to search for work? (First Method).
I & O Check Item 1 screen for dependent I and O
I & O Check Item 2 screen for previous months I and O cases
Last month, it was reported that you worked for (Employer's name). Do you still work for (Employer's name) (at your main job)?
Have the usual activities and duties of your job changed since last month?
Last month you were reported as (a/an) (Occupation) and your usual activities were (description). Is this an accurate description of your current job?
Is this business or organization mainly manufacturing, retail trade, wholesale trade, or something else?
Is this business or organization mainly manufacturing, retail trade, wholesale trade, or something else?
Not in labor force check item - 1.
Not in labor force check item - 2.
Labor force information collected by self or proxy response
Does your disability prevent you from accepting any kind of work during the next six months?
Do you have a disability that prevents you from accepting any kind of work during the next six months?
Do you receive any payments or profits from the business?
Are you now in the Armed Forces?
Highest level of school completed or degree received.
Did you ever serve on active duty in the U.S. Armed Forces?
How did (they/he/she) get (their/his/her) high school diploma?
What was the highest grade of regular school (they/he/she) completed before receiving (their/his/her) GED?
How many years of college credit has (they/he/she) completed?
Line number of second parent (always the mother, if present. Will be a male if the parents are same sex).
Line number of first parent (always the father, if present. Will be a female if the parents are same sex).
Type of PEPAR1 edited universe: All - 1 No PEPAR2 present.
Type of PEPAR2 edited universe: All - 1 No PEPAR1 present.
Marital status based on Armed Forces participation.
Detailed Hispanic origin group, revised January 2014.
Number of own children < 18 years of age.
Presence of own children < 18 years of age by selected age group.

Person's age. Note: This variable was labeled as PEAGE in prior versions of this documentation even though it contained the public use version of age that was top-coded and underwent further masking steps to protect the confidentiality of individuals in the sample.
Are you being paid by your employer for any of the time off last week?
What is the main reason you were absent from work last week?
Last week, could you have started a job if one had been offered?
Did you look for work at any time in the last 12 months?
Since you left that job or business have you looked for work?
What is the main reason you were not looking for work during the last 4 weeks?
Did you actually work at a job or business during the last 12 months?
Do you currently want a job, either full or part time?
Did you do any of this work during the last 4 weeks?
Last week, how many hours did you actually work at your job?
Last week, how many hours did you actually work at your other job(s)?
Last week, could you have worked full-time if the hours had been available?
Do you usually work 35 hours or more per week?
What is your main reason for working part-time?
What is the main reason you do not want to work full-time?
What is the main reason you worked less than 35 hours last week?
How many hours per week do you usually work at your main job?
How many hours per week do you usually work at your other job(s)?
Do you want to work a full-time work week of 35 hours or more per week?
What is the main reason you left your last job?
Do you intend to look for work during the next 12 months?
Have you worked at a job or business at any time during the past 12 months?
Could you have returned to work last week if you had been recalled?
FT/PT status of job from which sample person was on layoff from.
Even though you are to be called back to work, have you been looking for work during the last 4 weeks?
Last week, could you have started a job if one had been offered?
Before you started looking for work, what were you doing: working, going to school, or something else?
Did you lose or quit that job, or was it a temporary job that ended?
What are all of the things you have done to find work during the last 4 weeks? (First method).
Altogether, how many jobs do you have?
Do you have more than one job?
What best describes your situation at this time? For example, are you disabled, ill, in school, taking care of house or family, or something else?
When did you last work at a job or business?
Do you currently want a job, either full or part-time?
Reason not at work and pay status.
Reason not at work or hours at work.
At work 1 - 34 by hours at work.
Duration of unemployment for layoff and looking records.
Labor force by time worked or lost.
NILF recode - Want a job or other NILF.
Individual class of worker code on first job. Note: A PEIO1COW code can be assigned even if an individual is not currently employed.

Individual class of worker on second job. Note: For those self-employed unincorporated on their first job, this should have a response every month. For all others, this should only have a value in out-going rotations.
Does this person usually have any paid employees? See location 637 - 638 for the allocation flag.
Does this person usually have any paid employees? See location 787 - 788 for the allocation flag.
Allocation Flag PXERNWKP 2 Allocation Flag 791 to 792.
Employed persons (non-farm and non-private household) recode
Non-Agriculture Wage and Salary Workers Recode
Non-Agriculture, Private Wage and Salary Workers Recode
Detailed Class of Worker Recode - Job 1
Detailed Class of Worker Recode - Job 2
Do you usually receive overtime pay, tips, or commissions at your job?
How many weeks a year do you get paid for?
Even though you told me it is easier to report your earnings (periodicity); are you paid at an hourly rate on your (main/this) job?
On this job, are you a member of a labor union or of an employee association similar to a union?
On this job, are you covered by a union or employee association contract?
Allocation flag weekly earnings recode (PTERNWA) allocation flag.
Allocation flag hourly earnings recode (PTERNHLY) allocation flag.
Would that be high school, college, or university?
Last week, were you enrolled in a high school, college, or university?
Are you enrolled in school as a full-time or part-time student?
NLF activity - in school or not in school.
Is this person deaf or does he/she have serious difficulty hearing?
Is this person blind or does he/she have serious difficulty seeing even when wearing glasses?
Because of a physical, mental, or emotional condition, does he/she have serious difficulty concentrating, remembering, or making decisions?
Does he/she have serious difficulty walking or climbing stairs?
Does he/she have difficulty dressing or bathing?
Because of a physical, mental, or emotional condition, does he/she have difficulty doing errands alone such as visiting a doctor's office or shopping?
Does this person have any of these disability conditions?
Final weight (4 implied decimal places) used for most tabulations, controlled to independent estimates for 1) states; 2) origin, sex, and age; and 3) age, race, and sex.
Longitudinal weight (4 implied decimals) only found on adult records matched from month to month (used for gross flows analysis).
Veterans weight (4 implied decimals) used for tallying veteran's data only, controlled to estimates of veterans supplied by VA.
Outgoing rotation weight (4 implied decimals) used for tallying information collected only in outgoing rotations (i.e., earnings, 2nd job I & O, detailed NILF).
Family weight (4 implied decimals) only used for tallying family characteristics.
Composited Final Weight. Used to create BLS's published labor force statistics (4 implied decimal places).
Out variable for hourly rate of pay (2 implied decimals)
(Excluding overtime pay, tips and commissions) What is your hourly rate of pay on your (main/this) job? Dollar amount – 2 implied decimals
What is your hourly rate of pay on this job, excluding overtime pay, tips or commission? Dollar amount – 2 implied decimals
Excluding all owners, how many paid employees does this person usually have? See location 681 - 682 for the allocation flag.
Excluding all owners, how many paid employees does this person usually have? See location 789 - 790 for the allocation flag.
Specific Metropolitan CBSA Code (see Geographic Attachment).
Consolidated Statistical Area (CSA) FIPS Code (see Geographic Attachment).
